Home / Interviews / Interviews by Community / General

General

General brings together 100 interviews from 2011 to 2015. Recurring themes include developer community and conference conversations, conference speaking and presentation skills, and community building and user-group organizing. Featured interviewees include Angelique Martin, Dean Wampler, Giles Bowkett, and Aaron Bedra.

  • Coverage: 100 interviews from 2011 to 2015.
  • Featured interviewees: Angelique Martin, Dean Wampler, Giles Bowkett, Aaron Bedra, and Aaron Holbrook.
  • Common themes: developer community and conference conversations, conference speaking and presentation skills, community building and user-group organizing, Ruby and Rails practice, and developer education and learning.

Notable Contributors

  • Rebecca Parsons — CTO at Thoughtworks; noted technology strategy author/speaker. Focus: Technology strategy, architectural governance, and enterprise modernization. Interview
  • Dean Wampler — Author and speaker on Scala, big data, and functional systems. Focus: Distributed systems, data platforms, and functional architecture. Interview
  • Ola Bini — Co-creator of XMLBuilder for Ruby; language/runtime contributor. Focus: Language tooling, polyglot systems, and runtime architecture. Interview
  • Sandro Mancuso — Co-founder of the London Software Craftsmanship community. Focus: Software craftsmanship practice, mentoring, and engineering standards. Interview
  • Gary Bernhardt — Creator of Destroy All Software. Focus: Software design clarity, developer tooling, and code quality discipline. Interview
  • Robert Martin — Agile Manifesto signatory; co-author of the Software Craftsmanship Manifesto; Clean Code author. Focus: Software craftsmanship, engineering professionalism, and sustainable delivery practices. Interview
  • Brian Marick Interview
  • Corey Haines Interview
  • Giles Bowkett Interview
  • Avdi Grimm Interview
  • Andy Lester Interview
  • Anita Sengupta Interview

Interview with Dean Wampler @ GOTO Chicago 2015
Interviewee: Dean Wampler
Topic: conference speaking and presentation skills
Uploaded: Apr 20, 2022
Conference: GOTO Conference 2015 · Community: General
View Interview Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview dean-wampler conference goto-conference goto-conference-2015 conference-speaking-and-presentation-skills
Video description: Dean Wampler is a technology surfer, always riding the lip of the curve. Dean is a frequent speaker on AOP, Functional Programming with Scala, and Big Data as well as a user-group founder and author. Most recently he’s started the Chicago-Area Scala Enthusiasts (CASE) group. If you’re interested in Scala you need to checkout “Programming Scala” by Dean Wampler & Alex Payne.

Interview with Kresten Thorup
Interviewee: Kresten Thorup
Topic: developer community and conference conversations
Uploaded: Jan 07, 2022
Community: General
View Interview Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview kresten-thorup developer-community-and-conference-conversations community conference
Video description: What do you get when you cross a crab with a desire for technical community near you? Well, if that crab is Kresten Krab Thorup you end up with a global series of conferences that attract the highest quality speakers and attendees. GOTO, JAOO and Yow! are some of the major events that are put on by the good folks at Trifork throughout the year. They also organize smaller local events like GOTOnights and NoSql days.

Interview with Mike Lee
Interviewee: Mike Lee
Topic: developer community and conference conversations
Uploaded: Jan 07, 2022
Community: General
View Interview Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview mike-lee developer-community-and-conference-conversations community conference
Video description: Mike Lee is the Mayor of Appsterdam, a global community of app makers that was originated in Amsterdam. One of the most fascinating things about Appsterdam is that they actually have data to backup the claim that a vibrant tech community is a Good Thing for the greater community they exist within. The University of Amsterdam conducted a study and published their data, you can read the report.

Interview with Hadi Hariri
★ Transcript Available
Interviewee: Hadi Hariri
Topic: developer community and conference conversations
Uploaded: Jan 07, 2022
Community: General
View Interview Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview hadi-hariri developer-community-and-conference-conversations community conference
Video description: Hadi is a developer evangelist with JetBrains and has observed and spoken with a lot of developers in the wild over the years. One of the things he’s observed is the stereotype of the anti-social geek isn’t too far from the truth for a large part of our profession. Hadi proposes that we need to encourage openness, communication, humility, and awareness of the global picture beyond our own jobs.

Interview with Ken Auer
Interviewee: Ken Auer
Topic: developer community and conference conversations
Uploaded: Jan 07, 2022
Community: General
View Interview Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview ken-auer developer-community-and-conference-conversations community conference
Video description: Ken Auer is one of the pioneers of what we now call “Software Craftsmanship”. He was mentoring and practicing the techniques that were eventually described as XP long before these concepts were even getting acknowledged by Dr. Dobbs.

Interview with Rob Reynolds
Interviewee: Rob Reynolds
Topic: developer community and conference conversations
Uploaded: Jan 07, 2022
Community: General
View Interview Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview rob-reynolds developer-community-and-conference-conversations community conference
Video description: Rob Reynolds is a whirling dervish of F/OSS projects, epic sideburns and Chuck Norris references. He was the creator of the RoundhousE or UppercuT project and many other automation tools for the .NET platform before he worked on the original Nubular (Nu) project. Rob explains the origins of NuGet, how he got involved in creating F/OSS on .NET, and why he created Chocolatey.
Interview with Ryan Slobojan
Interviewee: Ryan Slobojan
Topic: developer community and conference conversations
Uploaded: Jan 07, 2022
Community: General
View Interview Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview ryan-slobojan developer-community-and-conference-conversations community conference
Video description: Ryan Slobojan was at GOTO Chicago interviewing speakers for InfoQ.com and I managed to turn the camera around on him to learn more about his interviews. One of the interesting differences was whether the host is on camera. He wants to enforce focus on the subject while allowing himself to be the one-man band managing the tech side of the interviews. UGtastic interviews, for better or worse, are intentionally with the host on camera in an attempt to give the sense of three people in the room chat

Michael Eaton
★ Transcript Available
Interviewee: Michael Eaton
Topic: conference speaking and presentation skills
Duration: 13 min · Uploaded: Apr 27, 2013
Community: General
View Interview Watch on Vimeo Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview michael-eaton rails conference community leadership career web dotnet conference-speaking-and-presentation-skills developer-community-and-conference-conversations
Video description: Michael and I chat about building a technical event that is open enough for even non-techies to come out and have a good time. Kalamazoo X is a “soft-skills” conference targeted at developers. We discuss what types of speakers he looks for for Kalamazoo X and how he works with them to fit the framework of the conference. By keeping talks time down to a short 20 minutes the attention and energy level is better and can be kept up across multiple speakers. The duration helps avoid the drop in atten
Sam Serpoosh
★ Transcript Available
Interviewee: Sam Serpoosh
Topic: community building and user-group organizing
Duration: 12 min · Uploaded: Apr 26, 2013
Community: General
View Interview Watch on Vimeo Watch on Youtube
ugtastic interview sam-serpoosh rails agile testing conference community open-source dotnet community-building-and-user-group-organizing developer-community-and-conference-conversations
Video description: I bumped into Sam at SCNA 2012 and had a nice but short conversation about tech culture in Iran and what the tech community scene looks like. Iran is a country that is frequently focused on in US news for political reasons. Getting to talk with Sam was a great reminder that despite all the rhetoric by our governments; there are people who are interested in the same things as me and other programmers around the world.

Sergio Pereira — Chicago Alt.NET
★ Transcript Available
Interviewee: Sergio Pereira
Topic: Chicago Alt.NET
Duration: 15 min · Uploaded: Nov 19, 2011
Conference: SCNA 2011 · Community: General
View Interview Watch on Vimeo Watch on Youtube
microsoft illinois chicago alt-net chicago-alt-net ugtastic interview sergio-pereira conference scna software-craftsmanship-north-america scna-2011 ruby testing developer-community-and-conference-conversations community
Video description: My first interview for Ugtastic is with Sergio Pereira who runs the Chicago Alt.NET group. Chicago Alt.NET holds a special place in my heart as it's the first user-group I attended and the first user-group I ever spoke at. Sergio shares his feelings on providing a platform for developers who may not otherwise have an opportunity to get up and share their experience and passions via Chicago Alt.NET. This was my first interview so comments and tips are welcome. Sergio is a great sport and I really appreciate him taking the time to sit down and chat about Chicago Alt.NET.
